messages.content: Tyler, the junior developer I'm mentoring, is joining me for some pair programming on the frontend PR. Can you review the code and make sure there are no violations of our style rules? No console.log statements left in, no 'any' types in TypeScript.
Reviewed the code. Found 2 console.log statements in task-list.tsx and 1 usage of 'any' type in the API response handler. These need to be fixed before we can merge.
Yeah those are my pet peeves. Remove the console.logs and replace the 'any' with 'unknown' or a proper type. Never use 'any' in TypeScript - use 'unknown' if you really need something generic.
Removed the console.log statements and replaced the 'any' with a proper TaskResponse type. Also found a hardcoded API key that Tyler accidentally left in - removed it and moved to .env.local.
Good catch on the secret. Never hardcode secrets or API keys. We always use .env.local for local development environment variables. That file is gitignored.
Verified .env.local is in .gitignore. Also ran the pre-commit hooks to catch any other issues. Everything passes now.
Perfect. Jake Morrison will review the frontend PR since that's his area. I'll let Tyler know about the issues so he can learn from them.
Pushed the fixes. PR is ready for Jake's review. I've added comments inline explaining the changes so Tyler can see what was wrong.
